basics.name: Lukelo Thadei Luoga
basics.label: Computer Engineer
basics.summary: A computer engineering graduate passionate about artificial intelligence, machine learning, and their applications in healthcare and autonomous systems.

work.name: Center for Interacting Urban Networks (CITIES), NYUAD
work.summary: Conducting cutting-edge research in AI security for autonomous systems.
highlights: Developed ViT4Purge framework leveraging Vision Transformers to identify poisoned samples.
Designed attention map-based classifiers for trigger-agnostic defenses in AI systems.
Collaborated on integrating CARLA and SUMO for simulation-based security testing.

work.name: C2SMARTER, NYU Tandon School of Engineering
work.summary: Contributed to innovative solutions in intelligent transportation systems.
highlights: Integrated SUMO with CARLA for dynamic traffic simulations.
Developed adaptive traffic signal systems and trajectory prediction algorithms.
Presented a poster on Urban Work Zone Detection, winning second place at the ITS-NY Annual Meeting.

volunteer.summary: Fostered a supportive residential environment for 23 residents through programs, meetings, and personal guidance, promoting learning and accountability.

volunteer.organization: Africa Global Student Interest Group — NYUAD
volunteer.summary: Led logistical coordination of Afro Fest, managing event setup, promotion, attendee tracking, and feedback collection for continuous improvement.
Organized and facilitated weekly online workshops, empowering young boys to engage, grow, and lead amidst challenges of the coronavirus pandemic.

volunteer.organization: Contract Staff Appreciation Week Committee — NYUAD
volunteer.summary: Coordinated events recognizing 800+ contract workers, fostering a culture of gratitude among students and faculty.
Led a $1000 project to construct modern toilets for a primary school, improving health standards and teaching conditions.

awards.title: NYU Founders' Day Award
awards.summary: Awarded to the top 40% of baccalaureate candidates recognized as outstanding scholars.

awards.title: Latin Honors: Cum Laude
awards.summary: Graduated in the top 15% of the engineering division at NYUAD.

publications.name: Advancing Healthcare in Low-Resource Environments Through Optimization and Deployment Framework for Medical Multimodal Large Language Models
publications.summary: Presented at the IEEE-EMBS International Conference on Biomedical and Health Informatics, focusing on efficient deployment of medical multimodal LLMs in resource-constrained settings.

publications.name: Democratizing MLLMs in Healthcare: TinyLLaVA-Med for Efficient Healthcare Diagnostics in Resource-Constrained Settings
publications.summary: Presented at the IEEE ICIP BID Workshop, focusing on TinyLLaVA-Med for efficient diagnostics in healthcare.
